fileheader.author: Richard Harrison
fileheader.description:
Models an F14-B with GE engines. The aerodata used is from ref[1] volumes 1 and 2 is only for sweep of 22degrees, positive alpha, clean, low speed so various data have been extrapolated estimated based on best available data where I cannot find specific details for F14 other aero models that I can find (often using NASA CR-1756 as guidance for general trends) are guidance or starting point for each value. The estimation of negative alpha values follows CR-1756 trends with values based on F14 data for positive values.
Engine Thrust are based on NASA-TM-104326 tables 4-6 adjusted for altitude and with augmentation figures based on that of the mil thrust.
The flaps and auxiliary flaps coefficients are modelled based on tuning to meet F-14AAD-1 as no data is currently available. The proportions assigned are relative to their surface area (as measured roughly 64% main, 36% aux) - the values assigned are 0.7 and 0.3 based on this and this applies to ClDFM, CdDFM and CMDFM
fileheader.note: Aircraft origin for measurements is the nose.
Low speed clean should be exactly as an F-14 as this model is based on accurate aerodata (see limitations below).
fileheader.limitation: Spoilers, sweep, speedbrake, flaps, gear aerodata not modelled in ADA101648 - figured out values are be used

function.name: aero/coefficients/Cmach
function.description: Mach factor (all except drag) (NASA-TM-84643 Figure 3 Clalpha) and values for AOA derived from NASA-aaia-2000-0900 Figure 4

function.name: aero/coefficients/CdTNK
function.description: Incremental Cd due to external tanks

function.name: aero/coefficients/ClSweepFactor
function.description: Wing sweep factor from norm of 22 (NASA-TM-D-6909)

function.name: aero/coefficients/DClSLM
function.description: Delta Cl due to mean slat position

function.name: aero/coefficients/ClDFM
function.description: Delta Cl due to mean flap position

function.description: Delta Cl due to mean aux flap position
